title: How to Be Prepared for Natural Disasters
title_html: How to Be Prepared for Natural Disasters
content:
Fill out an emergency plan.  Create an emergency plan for your family in case of a natural disaster. Include household information, out-of-town contacts, and school, workplace, and childcare contact information and emergency contingencies. Add your evacuation routes and shelter plans as well. Several websites have templates for emergency plans, like  https://www.ready.gov/make-a-plan . [1] 
 WH.performance.mark('step1_rendered');

<div class="section sticky hasad" id="intro">
<h1 class="firstHeading no_toc"><a href="https://www.wikihow.com/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters">How to Be Prepared for Natural Disasters</a></h1>
<div class="ss_check" id="expert_coauthor">
	
	Co-authored by <a class="expert_icon expert_coauthor_link" href="#article_info_section">
		Direct Relief</a>
</div>
<p class="vertical_toc" id="method_toc">
<span>Explore this Article</span>
<a class="toc_method" href="#Creating_a_Plan_sub" id="">Creating a Plan</a>
<a class="toc_method" href="#Packing_an_Emergency_Kit_sub" id="">Packing an Emergency Kit</a>

<div hidden="" id="sp_icon_hover">
<div id="sp_icon_body">
		This article was co-authored by <a href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=directrelief#directrelief">Direct Relief</a>. Direct Relief is an award-winning humanitarian aid organization, active in all 50 states and more than 80 countries. They focus on helping people affected by emergencies and natural disasters. Direct Relief has been highly rated by Charity Navigator, GuideStar, and the Center for High Impact Philanthropy at University of Pennsylvania, for their effectiveness, efficiency, and transparency.<br/><br/>There are <a href="#references">20 references</a> cited in this article, which can be found at the bottom of the page.
		
	</div>
</div>
<p>The thought of a natural disaster can be frightening, but you can prepare yourself and your family with a few simple steps. Though you may not know what kind of disaster will strike or when, if you take the time to prepare for several possible scenarios you’ll be ready in the event of an emergency.</p>

<h2 class="hidden"><span class="mw-headline" id="Steps">Steps</span></h2>
<a class="anchor" name="Creating_a_Plan_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky steps_first">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>1</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Creating_a_Plan">Creating a Plan</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_1">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-1-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=41692" href="#/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-1-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/94/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-1-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_cb19d0393c" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_cb19d0393c')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/94/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-1-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript>
<script>WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');</script></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Fill out an emergency plan.</b> Create an emergency plan for your family in case of a natural disaster. Include household information, out-of-town contacts, and school, workplace, and childcare contact information and emergency contingencies. Add your evacuation routes and shelter plans as well. Several websites have templates for emergency plans, like <a class="external free" href="https://www.ready.gov/make-a-plan" rel="nofollow">https://www.ready.gov/make-a-plan</a>.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 1" class="reference" id="_ref-1"><a href="#_note-1">[1]</a></sup>
<script>WH.performance.mark('step1_rendered');</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-2-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=41692" href="#/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-2-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/de/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-2-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_3c33704793" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_3c33704793')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/de/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-2-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Discuss how to prepare and respond to most likely disasters.</b> Consider scenarios for the events that are most likely to happen in your area. Make sure everyone in your family knows how to react to different disasters, including <a href="/Survive-a-Tornado" title="Survive a Tornado">tornadoes</a>, <a href="/Survive-a-Hurricane" title="Survive a Hurricane">hurricanes</a>, <a href="/Survive-a-Flood" title="Survive a Flood">floods</a>, <a href="/Survive-a-Wildfire" title="Survive a Wildfire">fires</a>, <a href="/Survive-a-Winter-Storm" title="Survive a Winter Storm">winter storms</a>, and <a href="/Prepare-for-a-Power-Outage" title="Prepare for a Power Outage">power outages</a>. Pinpoint the safest spots in your home for each type of disaster.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 2" class="reference" id="_ref-2"><a href="#_note-2">[2]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>For example, make an emergency plan for a flood if you live near a waterway, or an emergency plan for a winter storm if you live in a cold climate.</li>
<li>The highest level in your home is the safest place during a flood, while the lowest level is safest during a tornado, for instance.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-3-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=41692" href="#/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-3-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f3/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-3-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_3a62288f4f" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_3a62288f4f')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f3/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-3-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Identify 3 ways to get warnings.</b> Sirens are generally insufficient warnings for natural disasters. However, in case of a power outage, you cannot rely solely on your television or landline phone for warnings, either. Sign up to receive emergency alerts from your local government by text message or email. You should also have a battery-operated AM/FM radio (and extra batteries) on hand as well.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 3" class="reference" id="_ref-3"><a href="#_note-3">[3]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-4-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=41692" href="#/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-4-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0a/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-4-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_a88415a60e" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_a88415a60e')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0a/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-4-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Determine the best evacuation routes.</b> Identify all the entries and exits in your home and plan how you will evacuate your home (by car or by foot, for instance). Determine where you will go in the event that you cannot remain in your home or even in your region. Then, map out several routes for getting out of your city and state or region. Be sure to brief all your family members about evacuation strategies and exit plans.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 4" class="reference" id="_ref-4"><a href="#_note-4">[4]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>It’s important to have multiple options in case roadways are damaged during a disaster.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-5-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=41692" href="#/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-5-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/80/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-5-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_01e283cb3d" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_01e283cb3d')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/80/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-5-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Decide how family members will communicate.</b> Come up with a communication plan in case you are separated in the event of a disaster.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 5" class="reference" id="_ref-5"><a href="#_note-5">[5]</a></sup> You may want to provide each member of the family with a prepaid cell phone and charger, for instance. Make a contact card for each member of the family so they have all the phone numbers and addresses they may need.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 6" class="reference" id="_ref-6"><a href="#_note-6">[6]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Text messages are more reliable than phone calls during emergencies. Make sure children know how to operate a cell phone and send a text message.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-6-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=41692" href="#/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-6-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f3/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-6-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_208544fe4d" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_208544fe4d')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f3/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-6-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Choose multiple meeting spots.</b> In case all of your family members aren’t able to reach a designated meeting place, you should have several contingencies. Choose one location in your neighborhood or close to your home as well as one that is located out of town. Plan to meet at the closest location in the event of an emergency, and keep the out-of-town location as a backup in case a disaster prevents you from meeting at the primary location.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 7" class="reference" id="_ref-7"><a href="#_note-7">[7]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-7-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=41692" href="#/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-7-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/63/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-7-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_a5fa0df819" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_a5fa0df819')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/63/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-7-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 7" class="step_num">7</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_7"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Run practice drills.</b> It’s important to practice what to do in case of a natural disaster, especially if you have children. Each year, you should do a practice drill for each type of disaster that could occur.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 8" class="reference" id="_ref-8"><a href="#_note-8">[8]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>For example, <a href="/Conduct-a-Home-Fire-Drill" title="Conduct a Home Fire Drill">conduct a home fire drill</a> if you live in an area prone to drought and wildfire.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="methodad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-apsload="1" data-channels="3492389196" data-lateload="0" data-loaded="0" data-service="dfp" data-slot="" data-viewablerefresh="1">
<div id="methodad"></div>
<script>googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('methodad'); });</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addBodyAd('methodad')</script>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Packing_an_Emergency_Kit_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>2</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Packing_an_Emergency_Kit">Packing an Emergency Kit</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_2">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-8-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=41692" href="#/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-8-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fe/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-8-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_9487adf3a3" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_9487adf3a3')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fe/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-8-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Pack a 3-day supply of nonperishable food and water.</b> Choose food items with a long shelf life, such as canned goods and packaged pantry items. Opt for items that don’t require refrigeration, but also those that require little cooking in case you don’t have power due to a disaster. Store 1 gallon (3.8 L) of water per person (and per pet) per day. Don’t forget formula and bottles if you have an infant, as well as pet food for any pets.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 9" class="reference" id="_ref-9"><a href="#_note-9">[9]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Tap water may be unsafe to drink in the event of a disaster, so be sure to include plenty of purified water in bottles or jugs.</li>
<li>Canned soup, tuna, nuts, dried fruit, beef jerky, nut butter, protein bars, cereal, powdered milk, dry pasta, and packaged crackers are good options.</li>
<li>Don’t forget to pack a can opener, utensils, dishes, waterproof matches, and a camp stove, if possible.</li>
<li>At the minimum you should have a 3 day supply of food and water ready, but it’s best to store enough for 2 weeks.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-9-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=41692" href="#/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-9-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1b/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-9-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_7a44e82fae" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_7a44e82fae')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1b/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-9-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Include clothing, shoes, and toiletries.</b> Pack a 3-day supply of clothing (including multiple layers), socks, and an extra pair of shoes for each member of the family. Toiletries, like soap, shampoo, feminine products, toilet paper, toothbrushes, toothpaste, and deodorant should also be included. Add diapers and wipes if you have small children.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 10" class="reference" id="_ref-10"><a href="#_note-10">[10]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-10-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=41692" href="#/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-10-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9f/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-10-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_ec9790edfd" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_ec9790edfd')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9f/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-10-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Add shelter and safety supplies.</b> Pack emergency blankets, sleeping bags, and a tent or two in case you can’t stay in your home. A multipurpose tool (like a knife/file/pliers/screwdriver combo), and a whistle would also be handy to have in your kit.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 11" class="reference" id="_ref-11"><a href="#_note-11">[11]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-11-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=41692" href="#/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-11-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3f/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-11-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_476ba7c761" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_476ba7c761')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3f/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-11-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Pack electronics and batteries.</b> Include several flashlights, an AM/FM radio, and extra batteries. You may also want to include a prepaid cell phone with a charger in case your landline or cell phone doesn’t work during a natural disaster.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 12" class="reference" id="_ref-12"><a href="#_note-12">[12]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-12-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=41692" href="#/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-12-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/68/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-12-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_2359cece99" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_2359cece99')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/68/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-12-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Include medicine and a first aid kit.</b> Prescription and over-the-counter medicines should be included in your kit. Add a basic first aid kit containing instant ice packs, bandages, antiseptic ointment, scissors, tape, a suture kit, and so on. Pack extra glasses or contact lenses and solution, and any other medical supplies that may be needed, like a cane or hearing aids with extra batteries.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 13" class="reference" id="_ref-13"><a href="#_note-13">[13]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>You may want to include a field medicine handbook as well as a veterinary medicine handbook if you have pets.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 14" class="reference" id="_ref-14"><a href="#_note-14">[14]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-13-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=41692" href="#/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-13-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3a/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-13-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_2e5c3cc565" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_2e5c3cc565')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3a/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-13-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Add cash, maps, and spare keys.</b> It’s a good idea to store some cash in your emergency kit. Add a mix of small and large bills in case the banks or ATMs are closed. You should also include maps of the area as well as a spare house and car key.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 15" class="reference" id="_ref-15"><a href="#_note-15">[15]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-14-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=41692" href="#/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-14-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/32/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-14-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_9acd7ad50f" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_9acd7ad50f')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/32/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-14-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 7" class="step_num">7</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_7"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Store the kit in a cool, dry place.</b> To make sure your food and water last as long as possible, don’t store your kit near direct sunlight, excess moisture, or fluctuating temperatures. The ideal temperature range is from 40° to 70° F (4° to 21° C). While bathrooms and kitchens aren’t great options, basements and closets will do just fine.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 16" class="reference" id="_ref-16"><a href="#_note-16">[16]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>You may choose to prepare a second kit and store it in your car, if desired.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-15-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=41692" href="#/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-15-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 15" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4e/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-15-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-15-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_632f60ab47" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_632f60ab47')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 15" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4e/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-15-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-15-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 8" class="step_num">8</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_8"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Put important papers in a fireproof and waterproof lockbox.</b> Important papers could be lost in a natural disaster, so fill the box with copies of each family member’s ID as well as birth certificates, passports, deeds, and titles. You could also include insurance paperwork, immunization records, and a copy of your family emergency plan. Add a list of phone numbers and addresses for family members and other important contacts, too.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 17" class="reference" id="_ref-17"><a href="#_note-17">[17]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Keep both the box and key in your emergency kit.</li>
<li>Alternatively, you can scan important documents and store them on memory stick inside of a waterproof container in your kit.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-16-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=41692" href="#/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-16-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 16" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4d/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-16-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-16-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_5008514793" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_5008514793')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 16" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4d/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-16-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-16-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 9" class="step_num">9</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_9"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Rotate the items regularly.</b> To ensure the clothes and shoes fit and the food and medicine aren’t expired, you should rotate out the items every year or two. Purchase new supplies for your packs and use the existing supplies for your day to day needs.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 18" class="reference" id="_ref-18"><a href="#_note-18">[18]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div id="tocad_wrap">
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="tocad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-channels="3492389196" data-lateload="1" data-loaded="0" data-service="adsense" data-slot="3356467874" data-viewablerefresh="1" id="tocad_outer"><div class="step_ad" id="tocad"></div></div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addTOCAd('tocad')</script>
</div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Monitoring_Potential_Disasters_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>3</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Monitoring_Potential_Disasters">Monitoring Potential Disasters</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_3">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-17-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=41692" href="#/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-17-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 17" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/53/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-17-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-17-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_b78bad73cd" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_b78bad73cd')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 17" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/53/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-17-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-17-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Recognize potentially threatening situations.</b> Watch news and weather reports in your region so that you can be aware of potential disasters in the area. You can also download apps for your smartphone, like Natural Disaster Monitor or Weather Underground, that will alert you of potential disasters near your location.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 19" class="reference" id="_ref-19"><a href="#_note-19">[19]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-18-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=41692" href="#/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-18-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 18" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/dd/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-18-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-18-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_b5f12909a0" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_b5f12909a0')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 18" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/dd/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-18-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-18-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Prepare family members for what may happen.</b> If your family is at risk for exposure to a natural disaster, explain to them what is happening. Review your emergency preparedness plan so that everyone knows what to do in the event of a disaster. Make sure you are prepared to either shelter in place or evacuate, if necessary.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-19-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=41692" href="#/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-19-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 19" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/29/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-19-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-19-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_a206d54d55" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_a206d54d55')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 19" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/29/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-19-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-19-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Track the progress of imminent disasters.</b> Check back with your news station frequently so that you will be aware of changes in weather or conditions that could alter the course of a disaster. Sign up to receive alerts or updates from your local government or weather service so that you will be well informed of what’s happening.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage final_li">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-20-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=41692" href="#/Image:Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-20-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 20" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4f/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-20-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-20-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_956e047395" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_956e047395')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Prepared for Natural Disasters Step 20" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4f/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-20-Version-2.jpg/aid41692-v4-728px-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-20-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb"><a href="/Prepare-Your-Family-for-an-Emergency-Evacuation" title="Prepare Your Family for an Emergency Evacuation">Evacuate before disaster strikes</a>, if possible.</b> If danger is imminent in your area, evacuate before it strikes. Your local government or authority may order evacuations if a natural disaster is looming, so be sure to follow their instructions. If you aren’t able to evacuate, shelter in place until it is safe to leave the area.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 20" class="reference" id="_ref-20"><a href="#_note-20">[20]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>

<h2>
<div class="altblock"></div>

</h2>
<div class="section_text" id="qa">
<div id="qa_answered_questions_container">
<div id="qa_aq_search_container">
<div class="qa_section_heading" id="qa_aq_search_heading">Search</div>
<input class="qa_aq_search" placeholder="Type your query here"/>
</div>

<ul class="qa_questions qa_aqs qa_waittheresmore" id="qa_article_questions">
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="452941" data-caid="453814" data-cqid="452958" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="2020006" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="1" data-votes_up="16">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">How can I prevent one?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">There is no way to "prevent" a natural disaster. It is a part of nature, and it is something you cannot change.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>1</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>16</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="173438" data-caid="174311" data-cqid="173455" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="1142444" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="9" data-votes_up="44">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">Why I should be aware for natural disasters?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Because they could hurt or kill you, or ruin your property, if you don't take the right precautions. When things like this happen, make sure you are ready.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">

<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>9</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>44</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="367029" data-caid="367902" data-cqid="367046" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="1954782" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="3" data-votes_up="20">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">Can you suggest tips to prevent disasters?</div>

<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">There is no way to "prevent" a natural disaster. It is a part of nature, something you cannot change. </div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="458161" data-caid="459034" data-cqid="458178" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="2420470" data-submitter_id="4808624" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="2" data-votes_up="14">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">What happens if I'm pooping and there is a volcano erupting?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle" style="background-image:url(https://www.wikihow.com/skins/WikiHow/images/80x80_user.png)"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"><span class="qa_user_link" data-href="/User:Writingismypassion">Writingismypassion</span></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">If danger is not very imminent, quickly finish up. If it is very imminent, stop what you are doing immediately and take appropriate action to get to safety.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">

<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>

<div class="section quicksummary sticky summary_with_video" id="quick_summary_section">
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Quick_Summary">wikiHow Video: How to Be Prepared for Natural Disasters</span></h2>
<div class="section_text" id="quicksummary">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright summarysection" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player"><a href="/Video/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters" id="summary_video_link"><img class="m-video content-fill placeholder" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/40/Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-0-preview-Version-2.jpg/1000px-nowatermark-Be-Prepared-for-Natural-Disasters-Step-0-preview-Version-2.jpg" id="summary_video_poster"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('summary_video_poster')</script><div class="m-video-intro-over" style="visibility:visible"><div class="m-video-play">
<div class="m-video-play-count-triangle"></div> Watch</div></div></a>
</div></div></div>
<script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-9f3b2742aa'));
//]]>
</script>
</div>
<div id="summary_wrapper"><div id="summary_text">
<h2>Article Summary<a href="#" id="summary_close">X</a>
</h2>
<p>The best way to be prepared for a natural disaster is to fill an emergency pack with clothing, toiletries, medications, money, bottled water, and non-perishable food. Place it in an easily-accessible spot in your house away from sun, heat, and moisture. <span id="summary_last_sentence">For tips on how to create an emergency plan, stay alert to disaster warnings, and get in touch with family in case of emergency, read on!</span><span class="sumpos_bottom" id="summary_position"></span></p>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div class="s-help-wrap" data-type="summarytexthelp">
<span class="s-help-prompt">Did this summary help you?</span><button class="s-help-response" data-finish-prompt="Thank you! <a href='#' class='firststeplink'>Return to the article to learn more...</a>" data-prompt-text="We are so glad to have helped!" data-textarea-prompt="Please describe what was helpful in the video..." data-type="summarytexthelp" data-value="1" type="submit">Yes</button><button class="s-help-response" data-finish-prompt="Sorry the summary wasn't helpful. <a href='#' class='firststeplink'>Return to the article to learn more...</a>" data-prompt-text="Sorry that the video wasn't helpful." data-textarea-prompt="Please tell us what you would have liked to see in the video..." data-type="summarytexthelp" data-value="0" type="submit">No</button><div class="s-help-feedback-wrap">
<textarea class="s-help-textarea"></textarea><input class="s-help-submit button primary" type="button" value="Submit"/>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
<div id="qa_box"></div>
<div class="section tips sticky">
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Tips">Tips</span></h2>
<div class="section_text" id="tips">
<ul>
<li>If you live in an area prone to disasters that cause extended power outages, consider keeping a portable generator with a capacity of at least 5700 watts on hand.</li>
<li>Fill several 5 gallon (18.9 L) plastic gas containers with gasoline to power the generator. Add stabilizer to the gasoline to preserve it, and remember to rotate it out regularly.</li>
<li>In the event of a big disaster, be sure to have an AM or FM radio because the cell and Wi-Fi will most likely be down.</li>
<li>While a disaster can be frightening, panic will make your chances of getting through it worse. To stay clam, chew some gum or suck on hard candy. Read a book. If you are scared still, talk and express your worry. If you still have wifi, use the internet to talk with your friends.</li>
<li>Leave everything behind in the event of a disaster. You and your family are way more important than your laptop.</li>
</ul>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="section warnings sticky">
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Warnings">Warnings</span></h2>
<div class="section_text" id="warnings">
<ul>
<li>Candles, lanterns, and flame lamps are for outdoor use only. They should not be used indoors, especially if you have a gas stove or a gas heater.</li>
<li>If you are plugging your generator into your power supply, make sure you turn off the main breaker and keep the generator outside.</li>
</ul>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="section_text" id="article_info">
<p class="info author_info">This article was co-authored by <a href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=directrelief#directrelief">Direct Relief</a>. Direct Relief is an award-winning humanitarian aid organization, active in all 50 states and more than 80 countries. They focus on helping people affected by emergencies and natural disasters. Direct Relief has been highly rated by Charity Navigator, GuideStar, and the Center for High Impact Philanthropy at University of Pennsylvania, for their effectiveness, efficiency, and transparency.</p>

                    "position": 2,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Discuss how to prepare and respond to most likely disasters. Consider scenarios for the events that are most likely to happen in your area. Make sure everyone in your family knows how to react to different disasters, including tornadoes, hurricanes, floods, fires, winter storms, and power outages. Pinpoint the safest spots in your home for each type of disaster.[2]\nFor example, make an emergency plan for a flood if you live near a waterway, or an emergency plan for a winter storm if you live in a cold climate.\nThe highest level in your home is the safest place during a flood, while the lowest level is safest during a tornado, for instance."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 3,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Identify 3 ways to get warnings. Sirens are generally insufficient warnings for natural disasters. However, in case of a power outage, you cannot rely solely on your television or landline phone for warnings, either. Sign up to receive emergency alerts from your local government by text message or email. You should also have a battery-operated AM\/FM radio (and extra batteries) on hand as well.[3]"
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 4,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Determine the best evacuation routes. Identify all the entries and exits in your home and plan how you will evacuate your home (by car or by foot, for instance). Determine where you will go in the event that you cannot remain in your home or even in your region. Then, map out several routes for getting out of your city and state or region. Be sure to brief all your family members about evacuation strategies and exit plans.[4]\nIt\u2019s important to have multiple options in case roadways are damaged during a disaster."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 5,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Decide how family members will communicate. Come up with a communication plan in case you are separated in the event of a disaster.[5] You may want to provide each member of the family with a prepaid cell phone and charger, for instance. Make a contact card for each member of the family so they have all the phone numbers and addresses they may need.[6]\nText messages are more reliable than phone calls during emergencies. Make sure children know how to operate a cell phone and send a text message."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 6,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Choose multiple meeting spots. In case all of your family members aren\u2019t able to reach a designated meeting place, you should have several contingencies. Choose one location in your neighborhood or close to your home as well as one that is located out of town. Plan to meet at the closest location in the event of an emergency, and keep the out-of-town location as a backup in case a disaster prevents you from meeting at the primary location.[7]"
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 7,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Run practice drills. It\u2019s important to practice what to do in case of a natural disaster, especially if you have children. Each year, you should do a practice drill for each type of disaster that could occur.[8]\nFor example, conduct a home fire drill if you live in an area prone to drought and wildfire."
                    }
                }
            ]
        },
        {
            "@type": "HowToSection",
            "name": "Packing an Emergency Kit",
            "position": 2,
            "itemListElement": [
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 1,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Pack a 3-day supply of nonperishable food and water. Choose food items with a long shelf life, such as canned goods and packaged pantry items. Opt for items that don\u2019t require refrigeration, but also those that require little cooking in case you don\u2019t have power due to a disaster. Store 1 gallon (3.8 L) of water per person (and per pet) per day. Don\u2019t forget formula and bottles if you have an infant, as well as pet food for any pets.[9]\nTap water may be unsafe to drink in the event of a disaster, so be sure to include plenty of purified water in bottles or jugs.\nCanned soup, tuna, nuts, dried fruit, beef jerky, nut butter, protein bars, cereal, powdered milk, dry pasta, and packaged crackers are good options.\nDon\u2019t forget to pack a can opener, utensils, dishes, waterproof matches, and a camp stove, if possible.\nAt the minimum you should have a 3 day supply of food and water ready, but it\u2019s best to store enough for 2 weeks."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 2,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Include clothing, shoes, and toiletries. Pack a 3-day supply of clothing (including multiple layers), socks, and an extra pair of shoes for each member of the family. Toiletries, like soap, shampoo, feminine products, toilet paper, toothbrushes, toothpaste, and deodorant should also be included. Add diapers and wipes if you have small children.[10]"
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 3,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Add shelter and safety supplies. Pack emergency blankets, sleeping bags, and a tent or two in case you can\u2019t stay in your home. A multipurpose tool (like a knife\/file\/pliers\/screwdriver combo), and a whistle would also be handy to have in your kit.[11]"
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 4,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Pack electronics and batteries. Include several flashlights, an AM\/FM radio, and extra batteries. You may also want to include a prepaid cell phone with a charger in case your landline or cell phone doesn\u2019t work during a natural disaster.[12]"
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 5,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Include medicine and a first aid kit. Prescription and over-the-counter medicines should be included in your kit. Add a basic first aid kit containing instant ice packs, bandages, antiseptic ointment, scissors, tape, a suture kit, and so on. Pack extra glasses or contact lenses and solution, and any other medical supplies that may be needed, like a cane or hearing aids with extra batteries.[13]\nYou may want to include a field medicine handbook as well as a veterinary medicine handbook if you have pets.[14]"
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 6,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Add cash, maps, and spare keys. It\u2019s a good idea to store some cash in your emergency kit. Add a mix of small and large bills in case the banks or ATMs are closed. You should also include maps of the area as well as a spare house and car key.[15]"
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 7,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Store the kit in a cool, dry place. To make sure your food and water last as long as possible, don\u2019t store your kit near direct sunlight, excess moisture, or fluctuating temperatures. The ideal temperature range is from 40\u00b0 to 70\u00b0 F (4\u00b0 to 21\u00b0 C). While bathrooms and kitchens aren\u2019t great options, basements and closets will do just fine.[16]\nYou may choose to prepare a second kit and store it in your car, if desired."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 8,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Put important papers in a fireproof and waterproof lockbox. Important papers could be lost in a natural disaster, so fill the box with copies of each family member\u2019s ID as well as birth certificates, passports, deeds, and titles. You could also include insurance paperwork, immunization records, and a copy of your family emergency plan. Add a list of phone numbers and addresses for family members and other important contacts, too.[17]\nKeep both the box and key in your emergency kit.\nAlternatively, you can scan important documents and store them on memory stick inside of a waterproof container in your kit."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 9,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Rotate the items regularly. To ensure the clothes and shoes fit and the food and medicine aren\u2019t expired, you should rotate out the items every year or two. Purchase new supplies for your packs and use the existing supplies for your day to day needs.[18]"
                    }
                }
            ]
        },
        {
            "@type": "HowToSection",
            "name": "Monitoring Potential Disasters",
            "position": 3,
            "itemListElement": [
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 1,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Recognize potentially threatening situations. Watch news and weather reports in your region so that you can be aware of potential disasters in the area. You can also download apps for your smartphone, like Natural Disaster Monitor or Weather Underground, that will alert you of potential disasters near your location.[19]"
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 2,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Prepare family members for what may happen. If your family is at risk for exposure to a natural disaster, explain to them what is happening. Review your emergency preparedness plan so that everyone knows what to do in the event of a disaster. Make sure you are prepared to either shelter in place or evacuate, if necessary."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 3,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Track the progress of imminent disasters. Check back with your news station frequently so that you will be aware of changes in weather or conditions that could alter the course of a disaster. Sign up to receive alerts or updates from your local government or weather service so that you will be well informed of what\u2019s happening."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 4,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Evacuate before disaster strikes, if possible. If danger is imminent in your area, evacuate before it strikes. Your local government or authority may order evacuations if a natural disaster is looming, so be sure to follow their instructions. If you aren\u2019t able to evacuate, shelter in place until it is safe to leave the area.[20]"
                    }
                }
            ]
        }
    ],
    "description": "How to Be Prepared for Natural Disasters. The thought of a natural disaster can be frightening, but you can prepare yourself and your family with a few simple steps. Though you may not know what kind of disaster will strike or when, if you..."
}</script>

content_html: Fill out an emergency plan. Create an emergency plan for your family in case of a natural disaster. Include household information, out-of-town contacts, and school, workplace, and childcare contact information and emergency contingencies. Add your evacuation routes and shelter plans as well. Several websites have templates for emergency plans, like https://www.ready.gov/make-a-plan.[1]
